com.github.dandelion.core.option

Class Option<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dandelion.core.option.Option<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the option.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<Option<T>>

    public class Option<T>
extends Object
implements Comparable<Option<T>>

    Representation of a component option, which is used to configure different aspects of a component.

    Each Option is composed of:

    • a uniq name, which may be used in configuration properties
    • an associated OptionProcessor which indicates how the value of the option should be processed
    • a precedence to indicate if the Option should be processed before another one

    Options are registered in multiple ways:

    • Using one or more properties files
    • Using a JSP taglib
    • Using a Thymeleaf dialect
    • Using the API

    Options are usually stored in Map structures, such as Map<Option<?>, Object> where Object is the value of the option.

    Since:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    Thibault Duchateau
    See Also:
    OptionProcessor

        value - The value to set in the new entry.

      • appendIn

        public void appendIn(Map<Option<?>,Object> configurations,
            String value)

        Type-safe utility intended to update Option/value entry in the passed map, where the value is a StringBuilder.

        If the entry already exists, the new value is appended to the existing StringBuilder.

        Parameters:
        options - A map containing Options and their value.
        value - The value to set in the new entry.

      • appendIn

        public void appendIn(Map<Option<?>,Object> options,
            char value)

        Type-safe utility intended to update Option/value entry in the passed map, where the value is a single character.

        If the entry already exists, the new value is appended to the existing StringBuilder.

        Parameters:
        options - A map containing Options and their value.
        value - The value to set in the new entry.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Option<T> o)

        Compare options according to their precedence.

        Be careful: This implementation of compareTo breaks (o1.compareTo(o2) == 0) == (o1.equals(o2)), as two different options can have the same precedence.

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Option<T>>
        Parameters:
        o - the object to compare to.
        Returns:
        the comparison result.
